ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned that I deserve better from my department.
I gained a better understanding of the type of language, concepts, and skills I needed to write my thesis.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: We deserve more engagement and presence with our faculty advisors. This class, this experience has been very deadline-oriented, at the expense of our mental health. This is not a reflection of our major necessarily as it is a reflection of Yale's values AND each major's comfort with adhering to the distressing and inhumane standards of this institution. We not radical enough for me. It would be radical to not prioritize the prestige of this institution over the livelihoods of the students it fought so hard to recruit, right?
I appreciate the flexibility, that was the biggest strength. You can work at your own pace but will hopefully have your advisor to consult when you need help.

This was incredibly unorganized. The dates kept shifting back and forth last minute and we did not get the support we were promised (ie a grad school mentor). When support was asked for, it was usually given; however, overall everything was very confusing.
Lacked guidance and accountability, more check ins and structure would be appreciated

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Deadlines, grades, NO REAL BREAKS (5 singular days out of semester to replace an entire 14-day consecutive break is ridiculous) 

Nothing really worked about these three things, but our desire to stop suffering prevailed, I guess.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: We don't have much of a choice, but I will advise students to learn to say "no", and that grades will never be more important than our own wellness and joy.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: This class was entirely self-directed study.
